titleStmt.title: Neophuto-astrologos. = The novice-astrologer instructed in a New-Years-gift to Mr. William Lilly; occasioned by the scurrility, scandal, ignorance, and flattery of his Merlin for the ensuing year. With two dedicatory epistles; the one to the learned divines, the other to the honest astrologers of this nation. / By G.J. or J.G. which Lilly the parasite pleaseth.
titleStmt.author: Gadbury, John, 1627-1704.

titleStmt.title: Neophuto-astrologos. = The novice-astrologer instructed in a New-Years-gift to Mr. William Lilly; occasioned by the scurrility, scandal, ignorance, and flattery of his Merlin for the ensuing year. With two dedicatory epistles; the one to the learned divines, the other to the honest astrologers of this nation. / By G.J. or J.G. which Lilly the parasite pleaseth.
titleStmt.author: Gadbury, John, 1627-1704.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for E.C. and are to be sold at the Royal Exchange, Westminster-hall, and Paul's Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The first word of title is in Greek characters.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Feb. 23. 1659"; the 60 in the imprint date has been crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
